Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names and rerunning Test instances for Parameterized
 Tests
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=139771899; y=6Zaq01yDw4ZQ3NlcOhhLdf_0d-cme7RvfHpNdoAaXlg
X-Yahoo-Profile: dsaff

Jeff Grigg wrote:

> I think you're right.  For me, it works (and runs the code!) when
> rerunning individual test method instances /that were found using
> the standard TestSuite(TestCase) constructor/.  But for dynamically
> generated test cases, it doesn't rerun them.  Looks like an Eclipse
> bug to me.

Jeff,

I'm a little uncomfortable calling it a bug.  Since JUnit 3 allows fully 
dynamic test tree generation, it can be undecidable in advance whether a 
given test case will even be included in the suite that is run, and more 
difficult than that to actually dynamically reconstruct the test case 
alone without running the rest of the suite.

Eclipse will work correctly rerunning tests on suites made up of 
TestCases and TestSuites constructed in the usual way, such as 
suite.addTestCase(MyTest.class).  This seems to be a good way to cover 
80% of what users want.  Is there another JUnit 3 pattern so prevalent 
that addressing it would up that coverage to 90%?

One cool thing about JUnit 4 is that while you should be able to do 
arbitrary test-creation cleverness using the @RunWith annotation, this 
is a static annotation that IDE's can easily check.  So version 17.1 of 
some IDE might be able to rerun tests run with TestClassRunner (JUnit 4 
default) and OldTestClassRunner (JUnit 3 default), and if it turns out a 
lot of people are using Parameterized, 17.2 could add support for that.

Hope that helps,

    David Saff
